$schema.description: Reference to the Element Template JSON schema this document follows.

name.description: Template name. Shown during template selection and editing of a templated element. Required.

description.description: Template description. Shown during template selection and editing of a templated element.

version.description: Optional version of the template. If you add a version to a template, it will be considered unique based on its ID and version. Two templates can have the same ID if their version is different.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the element template is a default template.

deprecated.description: Marks the template as deprecated. Value can be either a boolean or an object with a message and a link to migration documentation.

message.description: Optional message to describe migration path.

documentationRef.description: URL pointing to template documentation. Must be a valid http(s) URL.

appliesTo.description: List of BPMN types the template can be applied to. Required.

elementType.description: Object that sets the type of the element. Some properties require a specific value for elementType.

value.description: Specifies the target BPMN element type. The element is replaced with the specified type when a user applies the template. Required if using elementType.

metadata.description: Some custom properties for further configuration.

keywords.description: List of keywords to help users find the template. Used in search and filtering, but not displayed in the UI.

entriesVisible.description: Defines whether all property input fields are shown, even those normally hidden by the template.
